bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 81 (Monday, May 15, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NEGUSE:H.R. 3338.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To authorize an additional district judgeship for thedistrict of Colorado and permit a court to be held withinFort Collins[Page H2349]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: This bill increases from seven to eight the total number of U.S. district court judgeships for the District of Colorado and requires court in that district to be additionally held at Fort Collins, Colorado. The President must appoint, with the advice and consent of the Senate, one additional judge for that judicial district.

bill.title: To authorize additional district judgeships for the district of Colorado, and for other purposes.

item.title: To authorize additional district judgeships for the district of Colorado, and for other purposes.
To authorize additional district judgeships for the district of Colorado, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
